column4: Is it possible to download nsidwrapper on windows, and then use it on linux or something?
do I have to set it on a CD then?
CD, USB drive, whatever you have.
packages.ubuntu.com lists ndiswrapper-utils, ndiswrapper-common, and ndisgtk -- so get all three.
and then if I have them on USB/CD, what should I do?
In GUI - double-click on the package.
dpkg -i *.deb should automatically install all three?
well, yeah. The "*.deb" part will match all .deb files in the current directory...
...so make sure you are in the correct directory before doing it. 'pwd' to show, 'cd' to change, 'ls' to list all files.
how do I go to an CD-rom in linux? which dir is it mostly?
Dunno. I think Ubuntu auto-mounts it to /media/cdrom/ ...
But I'm sure it will be inside /media/
